page.title: 19Hythe Ranges
page.content: In 1854 the{School of Musketry}was opened in Hythe to train officers and N.C.O's to use the new Enfield rifle. A firing range was opened on the seashore where the ranges are today. The name was later changed to the {Small Arms School}which remained in Hythe until 1968. The ranges today are used to train men from many regiments to use self loading rifles and general purpose machine guns. To do this they have static targets at different distances and moving targets. They have built a full size model of a street with pop up targets to aim at and there are big boxes to catch the bullets. The soldiers are counted when they arrive and checked again when they leave to make sure no-one has been lost or injured.
